results.title: Young and just beginning: Pierre
results.brief_description: Focuses on Pierre Quinn, a young French-Canadian boy from Hauterive, Quebec, as he trains and performs along with other young dancers at the National Ballet School of Canada. When the school began, there were no male students but now of the 147 student one quarter are male. Theis change in attitude toward the male dancer was influenced to a great extent by Nuryev and Baryshnikov.

results.title: 'Estampa flamenca'
results.creator_credit: Dave Ellis and Dave Ellis Films
results.brief_description: This film features Maria Benitez, one of the world’s great flamenco dancers, in rehearsal and performance in her native New Mexico. She discusses the Gypsy and Spanish origins of flamenco with members of her dance company, Estampa Flamenca. Narrated by Jose Rodriguez

results.title: You can't grow potatoes up there
results.creator_credit: Peter Crass and North West Territories Information
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of seal hunting in the traditional life of the Inuit Eskimo of Canada’s Arctic. Made on location with three groups of Inuit hunters, the films hows how their traditional existence has become dangerously threatened by anti-sealing publicity. Hunters show the different techniques used to hunt seal year round; the use that is made of the meat; and how the skins are prepared for sale.

results.title: Crystal clear
results.brief_description: Traces in detail the making of sugar from the planting and cultivating of the sugar cane to harvesting, the milling process, storage and shipping, the refining process and the distribution of refined sugar products. Most of the commentary in this film is given by people who actually work in the sugar industry. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The World outdoors: flashing silver
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sinclair and Douglas Sinclair Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at sport fishing on Moresby Island - the southern island of the Queen Charlotte Islands off the northern coast of British Columbia. Shows in action Roderick Haig-Brown, author and prominent fly fisherman, who fishes only for sport and releases his catches unharmed.

results.title: Ride the wind
results.brief_description: Captures the essence of the sport of hang gliding. Shows experienced hang glider pilots soaring over beach ridges or flying high over rugged mountains. Cameras mounted on the wing during takeoff, flight and landing, involve the audience in the thrill of the sport.

results.title: Potter's Song: Art and philosophy of Paul Soldner
results.creator_credit: David Hubbard, Dick Hoffman, Tom Hubbard and Crystal Productions
results.brief_description: Explains the work and philosophy of ceramic artist and educator, Paul Soldner. Shows him demonstrating his techniques he has developed to create his non-functional raku pottery, and discussing the changing course of his ceramic art and its relationship to the environment.

results.title: Hitler: the road to revenge
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Shows how Hitler’s personality, and the social, political and economic conditions in the 1930’s, played a large role in his rise to power. Also indicates the means by which he achieved power: mass psychology, propaganda and physical violence. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Uncalculated risk
results.creator_credit: Filmspace Productions and Russ Nichols Productions
results.brief_description: Shows what can go wrong when inexperienced people head down river in canoes, rafts and kayaks. Stresses that prior instruction is the best means of preventing accidents.
